Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.graphics

Class BoxSizeInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.gnwi.mfsim.model.graphics.BoxSizeInfo
  • public class BoxSizeInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Info class for simulation box coordinates and size
    Author:
    Achim Zielesny

        aXMin - Minimum x-coordinate of simulation box
        aXMax - Maximum x-coordinate of simulation box
        aYMin - Minimum y-coordinate of simulation box
        aYMax - Maximum y-coordinate of simulation box
        aZMin - Minimum z-coordinate of simulation box
        aZMax - Maximum z-coordinate of simulation box

      • getScaledBoxSizeInfo

        public BoxSizeInfo getScaledBoxSizeInfo​(double aScaleFactor)
        Returns box size info which is scaled by specified factor
        Parameters:
        aScaleFactor - Factor to scale box size
        Returns:
        Scaled box size info

      • getEnlargedBoxSizeInfo

        public BoxSizeInfo getEnlargedBoxSizeInfo​(double aPercentage)
        Enlarges box edges symmetrically with passed percentage value and returns corresponding box size info. NOTE: A percentage value of -100 or less is impossible.
        Parameters:
        aPercentage - Percentage value (positive: Enlargement, negative: Reduction). Value is NOT allowed to be less than -99 (see code).
        Returns:
        Enlarged box size info
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal argument exception if aPercentage is smaller than -99.

      • isInBox

        public boolean isInBox​(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace aPoint)
        Returns whether point is in box
        Parameters:
        aPoint - Point to be tested
        Returns:
        True: Point is in box, false: Otherwise

      • getBoxEdgePointArray

        public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] getBoxEdgePointArray()
        Returns array with edge points of box. The following points should be connected for box display (indices): 0-1, 0-2, 0-3, 1-4, 1-6, 2-4, 2-5, 3-5, 3-6, 4-7, 5-7, 6-7
        Returns:
        Array with edge points of box

      • getBoxSizeInfoDefinitionString

        public java.lang.String getBoxSizeInfoDefinitionString()
        Box size info definition string: This string may be used to instantiate a box size info with the same dimensions (see constructor).
        Returns:
        Box size info definition string

      • getFirstPoint

        public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace getFirstPoint()
        Returns first point for definition of this box size info
        Returns:
        First point for definition of this box size info or null if box size info was not defined by two points

      • getSecondPoint

        public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace getSecondPoint()

        Returns:
